Linking Providers

Source: vignettes/linking_providers.Rmd
linking_providers.Rmd
library(provider)
library(dplyr)
library(purrr)

Exploring links between providers can lead to many interesting insights. For example, there is a hospital in New York named Elizabethtown Community Hospital. Looking it up in the Provider Enrollment API gives us several avenues to go down:

provider_enrollment(organization_name = "Elizabethtown Community Hospital")
#> # A tibble: 4 × 7
#>   npi        pac_id   enroll_id specialty_code specialty state organization_name
#>   <chr>      <chr>    <chr>     <chr>          <chr>     <chr> <chr>            
#> 1 1891785184 3577554… O2004052… 12-70          PART B S… NY    ELIZABETHTOWN CO…
#> 2 1891785184 3577554… O2010111… 00-85          PART A P… NY    ELIZABETHTOWN CO…
#> 3 1487923637 3577554… O2019071… 12-59          PART B S… NY    ELIZABETHTOWN CO…
#> 4 1407061591 3577554… O2022082… 00-85          PART A P… NY    ELIZABETHTOWN CO…

First, we can see that it has one PAC ID, three different organizational NPIs, and four different Enrollment IDs. Looking it up in the Hospital Enrollment API gives us even more detail:

hospital_enrollment(organization_name = "Elizabethtown Community Hospital")
#> # A tibble: 2 × 31
#>   npi        enroll_id   enroll_state specialty_code specialty_desc facility_ccn
#>   <chr>      <chr>       <chr>        <chr>          <chr>          <chr>       
#> 1 1891785184 O201011100… NY           00-85          PART A PROVID… 331302      
#> 2 1407061591 O202208270… NY           00-85          PART A PROVID… 33Z302      
#> # ℹ 25 more variables: pac_id_org <chr>, organization_name <chr>,
#> #   incorp_date <date>, incorp_state <chr>, org_structure <chr>, address <chr>,
#> #   city <chr>, state <chr>, zip <int>, location_type <chr>,
#> #   multiple_npis <lgl>, proprietary_nonprofit <lgl>, sg_general <lgl>,
#> #   sg_acute_care <lgl>, sg_alcohol_drug <lgl>, sg_childrens <lgl>,
#> #   sg_long_term <lgl>, sg_short_term <lgl>, sg_psychiatric <lgl>,
#> #   sg_psychiatric_unit <lgl>, sg_rehabilitation <lgl>, …

The Hospital Enrollment API includes only Medicare Part A (hospital) providers, so we only get two rows back, but those include a new data point: two facility CCNs. Plugging those into the Facility Affiliations API, we can retrieve information on the individual providers practicing at this hospital. First, the all-numeric CCN (331302):

facility_affiliations(facility_ccn = 331302)
#> # A tibble: 174 × 8
#>    npi        pac_id_ind first_name middle_name last_name   suffix facility_type
#>    <chr>      <chr>      <chr>      <chr>       <chr>       <chr>  <chr>        
#>  1 1003815184 4082693676 ARMIN      NA          AFSAR KESH… NA     Hospital     
#>  2 1023076643 5698798452 JOHN       N           HENRY       NA     Hospital     
#>  3 1043245657 7810891009 MARK       K           FUNG        NA     Hospital     
#>  4 1043397656 4183764558 ANTHONY    F           TRAMONTANO  NA     Hospital     
#>  5 1043630510 2365749389 RYAN       NA          WOLFE       NA     Hospital     
#>  6 1053596122 5193802213 TANYA      JEAN        FINCH       NA     Hospital     
#>  7 1053863100 8729362207 MATTHEW    D           FARNSWORTH  NA     Hospital     
#>  8 1063592210 0042228009 ROBERT     D           PITTS       NA     Hospital     
#>  9 1073099172 0547519381 BROOKE     A           MAGGY       NA     Hospital     
#> 10 1073585055 0749217313 TODD       J           WHITMAN     NA     Hospital     
#> # ℹ 164 more rows
#> # ℹ 1 more variable: facility_ccn <chr>

That returns 174 individual providers affiliated with the Hospital. Now the alphanumeric CCN (33Z302):

facility_affiliations(facility_ccn = "33Z302")
#> # A tibble: 3 × 8
#>   npi     pac_id_ind first_name middle_name last_name facility_type facility_ccn
#>   <chr>   <chr>      <chr>      <chr>       <chr>     <chr>         <chr>       
#> 1 139698… 8921259557 MARY       K           HALLORAN  Nursing home  33Z302      
#> 2 153817… 0547299091 IL         JUN         CHON      Nursing home  33Z302      
#> 3 180189… 3577568724 ROB        L           DEMURO    Nursing home  33Z302      
#> # ℹ 1 more variable: parent_ccn <chr>

That returns three more affiliated individual providers that practice in the Hospital’s nursing home. An alphanumeric CCN represents a sub-unit of a Hospital, here a Nursing Home. We would get the same result if we’d set the parent_ccn argument to the numeric CCN:

facility_affiliations(parent_ccn = 331302)
#> # A tibble: 3 × 8
#>   npi     pac_id_ind first_name middle_name last_name facility_type facility_ccn
#>   <chr>   <chr>      <chr>      <chr>       <chr>     <chr>         <chr>       
#> 1 139698… 8921259557 MARY       K           HALLORAN  Nursing home  33Z302      
#> 2 153817… 0547299091 IL         JUN         CHON      Nursing home  33Z302      
#> 3 180189… 3577568724 ROB        L           DEMURO    Nursing home  33Z302      
#> # ℹ 1 more variable: parent_ccn <chr>
